content:
Cybersecurity measures can be seen as expensive and time-consuming, but the consequences of not implementing them can be catastrophic for businesses. If a company falls victim to a cyber attack, the financial and reputational damages can be significant.

Recovering from a breach can be extremely expensive, including paying the cost of restoring lost data or paying ransomware demands, regulatory fines, and potentially losing customers due to reputational damage. A breach also leads to loss of productivity and operational downtime.

Moreover, companies that store sensitive data like personal information or financial data are required by law to take measures to protect this information. Failure to do so can result in legal consequences and reputational damage.

Therefore, it’s crucial for companies to take cybersecurity seriously by implementing the appropriate measures based on their systems and risk profile. Investing in cybersecurity measures, good security practices, and training can go a long way in protecting the business and other stakeholders' interests in the long run.
